reviews.text: Hotel and location:
reviews.title: What a great find

reviews.text: Located smack in the middle of Old Istanbul (Sultanahmet) and within 2 minutes walking distance to the next tram station. Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque and other sights can be reached within 15 minutes walking. Hundreds of restaurants, stores and bars are in located within the area. Fairly quiet at night but try to get a room in the back, there is construction going on across from the hotel entrance and that can be quite noisy, even on on weekends. The hotel is a perfect size, not too big, not too small. There is a bar in the lobby and a restaurant for dinner and breakfast on the rooftop with a spectacular view of Old Istanbul. There is also a terrace in summer as well. Decor is tasteful (except for the awful fireplace), without the usual 'Kitsch' so it is easy on the Western eye.
reviews.title: Turkish charm

reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Unbeatable location and great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good size rooms, comfortable beds, fully equipped with everything you might need, including a small table, 2 chairs, flatscreen-TV, Minibar. Lots of amenities (something you don't often see anymore) and slippers in the bathroom (with bath)
reviews.title: Good location, but some noise and other problems

reviews.text: Staff:
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, Ottoman style decoration and original artifacts. Spacious rooms, good beds, sitting area (suitable to work), small balcony (front side rooms). Bathroom is good as well (bath with shower). Lobby and bar area are comfortable. Restaurant for breakfast and dinner at rooftop. Breafast is ok, could be bit better compared to good level of the accommodation.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good location on old city

reviews.text: Very professional and friendly Front Office.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel to experience the best of sultanahmet!

reviews.text: Great hotel and staff were very helpful. Within easy walking distance of great restaurants and all the major attractions in the area. Off the main tram line so no significant noise levels and rooftop breakfast terrace has amazing views of the city including the blue mosque and hagia sofia
reviews.title: Nice and cozy.

reviews.text: Had a very nice stay. Rooms were comfortable and breakfast was good. The rroftop restaurant seems to be an undiscovered gem. Decent views of Hagia Sofiya and Blue Mosque from the rooftop restaurant, but the highlight was the restaurant manager "Engen"(sp?). He was extremely helpful, and treated us like family. No request was unmet. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great small hotel in prime location
Friendly, comfortable, well positioned hotel.
reviews.text: We found that this hotel had a lot going for it---great location and wonderful staff. We'd visit again in a heartbeat, although book early to make sure you can get a room.

Have stayed here a couple of times now and each time the staff have been very helpful. Its in a perfect location making it really easy to get places. Bathrooms always clean only thing would be having a few.more would help over peak season. Would stay here again if i came back to Istanbul.
reviews.title: Would recommend staying here

reviews.text: This hotel has a prime location in the old area of Istanbul.
reviews.title: Prime location and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is cozy and the rooms have a good size.
reviews.title: Recommended! In the middle of everything yet relaxing and quiet

reviews.text: Everything is neat and clean and the hotel is very tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good experience at the hotel and the service is perfect. Any wish we had it was met with great helpfulness and a smile.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 6 days at the Sultanhan Hotel. It was perfect in every way. Istanbul is a wonderful city but it's also hot and crowded in August. Being in our room was like being in a cocoon. Comfortable, cool, and no noise. We had a very early flight home and the staff prepared a breakfast box for us to take to the airport. They made coffee for us before we left. We loved the views from the rooftop restaurant and the food was very good. All staff from the front desk to the waiters in the restaurant were helpful and professional. This is a well managed hotel in a great location. You can walk everywhere in the old town from here.
reviews.title: perfect hotel

reviews.text: nice hotel. great location. close to all sights. pretty lobby. desk staff was fabulous and helped us plan each day of our 5 days there. great rooftop views and buffet breakfast. would stay here again. traveling with my 15 year old daughter, felt very safe. thank you to everyone there.
reviews.title: good value/ great location

reviews.text: Our small group of six had 2 triple rooms, one for each famly and they couldn't have worked out better for us. We stayed there for six nights. As other reviewers have mentioned, the location was perfect. Walking distance to most of the major sights in the Old City. Close to 2 tram stations if you want to venture a little further. I don't recommend taxis in the Old City.
reviews.title: A perfect little hotel

reviews.text: The triple room had a queen and a single bed with a small sitting area. Although the view from the room was somewhat marred by the refurbishing of the next building, we could still see the minarets and domes of the near by mosques and a sliver of the Sea of Marmara. Rooms were impecably clean and beds were comfortable. Rooms must be very well insulated too because we were not woken up by early morning call to the prayers from mosques.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was good too. They have the traditional Turkish breakas fares like cheeses, olives, tomatoes and cucumber as well as eggs, yogurt, several fruit preserves and cereals too. We sat on the 5th floor balcony with a beautiful view of the Sea of Marmara and gentle breezes. Waiters brought us coffee or tea or anything else you may request. Everyone on the staff was couteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic
